Title: Mitsubishi Electric Trane HVAC US R-32 VRF Line Meets 2026 Low-GWP Standards
Summary: Mitsubishi Electric Trane HVAC US (METUS) introduced a new line of Variable Refrigerant Flow (VRF) systems using R-32 refrigerant, designed to meet upcoming low-global warming potential (GWP) standards that take effect in January 2026. The systems will be available in select markets beginning in early 2026.

Title: Samsung Electronics Ranks 5th in Global Brands for the Sixth Consecutive Year
Summary: Samsung Electronics today announced it has been recognized by Interbrand, a global brand consultancy, as the 5th-ranked global brand for the sixth year in a row. Interbrand releases its list of “Best Global Brands” each year. For this year’s list, Samsung recorded a brand value of $90.5 billion, upholding its position as the only Asian company to remain in the global top five since 2020.

Title: AI Experts Reveal #1 Tip for HVAC Contractors Adopting Artificial Intelligence
Summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer a distant concept—it’s already reshaping how contractors do business and how customers search for services. During the Nexstar Network's Super Meeting, technology leaders urged HVACR contractors to think beyond the buzz and focus on building a strong foundation for AI adoption. From optimizing field service management platforms to ensuring clean, accurate data, experts emphasized that success with AI starts with well-documented processes and clear implementation strategies. They also cautioned contractors to consider how their customers are using AI tools like ChatGPT to find HVAC services—and to make sure their businesses are ready to meet those digital demands.

Title: HVAC Excellence Accreditation Strengthens Wisconsin Workforce Development
Summary: MOUNT PROSPECT, Illinois — Northeast Wisconsin Technical College in Green Bay, Wisconsin, has earned programmatic accreditation from HVAC Excellence, confirming that its HVACR program meets the national standards outlined in the HVAC Excellence Accreditation Standards Manual.

Title: Where are UA2L Refrigerants Headed in the HVAC/R Market?
Summary: As sustainability and regulatory compliance become top priorities in the HVAC/R industry, UA2L refrigerants are gaining momentum as the next-generation solution for cooling systems. With mounting regulatory pressure, environmental urgency, and technological innovation, UA2L refrigerants are poised to reshape how we think about climate control.

Title: LG Launches New Program to Boost HVAC Dealer Growth and Training
Summary: ALPHARETTA, Georgia — LG Electronics introduced “Pathway to Platinum,” a new program designed to help HVAC dealers enhance performance, training, and customer relationships through a combination of education, incentives, and business development tools. The initiative was unveiled at the 2025 LG Pro Dealer Summit held in Orlando, Florida.

Title: REHVA Supporter Eurovent Certification: Desert certification
Summary: In the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) region, HVAC systems face extreme high ambient temperatures, yet most equipment is still certified using European or American Standards. While European and International Standards provide accurate and trusted benchmarks for temperate climates, additional testing is required for Gulf conditions. In response, Eurovent Certification has rolled out Desert Certification - a performance-based certification option available across several Eurovent Certified Performance programmes, tailored specifically to the harsh climate of the GCC.

Title: Ruskin XP500 Louver Simplifies Installation with New Flange Frame Design
Summary: The flange-mounted XP500 maintains the same high-performance standards as the original model, offering durable protection in severe weather conditions for applications such as data centers and community safe rooms.

Title: Panasonic WhisperFit DC Fan Adds Bluetooth Speakers for Dual Function Ventilation
Summary: Panasonic introduced the WhisperFit DC with Bluetooth Speakers, a new residential ventilation solution that integrates high-quality audio and humidity control in a single ENERGY STAR-certified unit. The product is designed for contractors and builders seeking efficient, code-compliant ventilation for bathrooms, laundry rooms, and other moisture-prone spaces.

Title: Family Ties, Business Strength: Sibling Team to Share Growth Strategies at We Mean Business Conference
Summary: DALLAS, TX — Sibling entrepreneurs Trey McWilliams and Crystal Williams will share their business-building insights at the upcoming We Mean Business conference, Nov. 9–11 at Wild Dunes Resort in Isle of Palms, South Carolina. The event brings together family-run HVAC, plumbing, and electrical businesses to explore how personal and professional partnerships can thrive together.

Title: Rinnai America Names Craig Bryan Vice President of Finance
Summary: Bryan now leads Rinnai’s North American Finance organization, providing strategic oversight for Accounting and Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). His role includes shaping financial strategies that align with Rinnai’s long-term growth objectives and operational goals.

Title: Water Hammer in Steam Systems
Summary: Water hammer in steam systems isn’t just loud—it’s dangerous. In this video, our boiler experts break down what water hammer is, why it happens, and how to prevent it in your facility. You’ll learn how condensate buildup, improper piping design, and sudden valve changes can create pressure spikes strong enough to damage equipment or injure personnel. Our boiler experts explain how pressure, velocity, and condensate buildup combine to create those violent shockwaves that travel through piping. Check out the Rasmussen Mechanical blog at www.rasmech.com/blog/boiler-water-conductivity and be sure to subscribe for more tips and tutorials.

Title: As oil market surplus keeps rising, something’s got to give
Summary: The global oil market may be at a tipping point as signs of a significant supply glut emerge. The overall oil surplus averaged 1.9 million barrels per day (mb/d) from January through September 2025. Crude oil prices remained largely resilient, as stock builds were concentrated in areas that have less direct influence on price formation, notably crude in China and gas liquids in the United States. Crude inventory levels in key pricing hubs remained relatively low. However, more recently, surging supplies from the Middle East and the Americas are pointing to an untenable surplus of nearly 4 mb/d in 2026, making it increasingly clear that something has to give.

Title: Greenheck Launches Fan Energy Index Resource Page for HVAC Professionals
Summary: SCHOFIELD, Wisconsin — Greenheck has introduced an online resource page dedicated to the Fan Energy Index (FEI), a key metric for evaluating fan system efficiency. The page provides HVAC professionals with practical guidance on applying FEI to select fan systems that operate more efficiently, quietly, and reliably.

Title: Carrier Transicold Launches Real-Time Emissions and Fuel Cost Insights in Lynx Fleet to Drive Sustainable Fleet Performance
Summary: Carrier Transicold is helping customers reduce waste, boost efficiency and meet environmental targets through enhancements to Lynx Fleet. New sustainability functionality delivers real-time insights into carbon emissions and fuel consumption, while offering intelligent recommendations tailored to each fleet’s behavior, supporting compliance with European climate regulations and enhancing operational decision making. Lynx Fleet will be showcased at Solutrans 2025, held Nov. 18-22 at Lyon EUREXPO. Carrier Transicold is part of Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions.

Title: Electrifying the Cold Chain: Carrier Transicold to Showcase Innovative [R]eCool Retrofit Refrigeration System at Solutrans 2025
Summary: Carrier Transicold will spotlight [R]eCool, an electric retrofit solution for Vector® refrigeration units, at Solutrans 2025, held Nov. 18-22 at Lyon EUREXPO. Unveiled in 2023 as one of the transport refrigeration industry’s first engineless retrofit cooling solutions, [R]eCool enables operators to convert diesel-powered refrigerated units on semi-trailers to hybrid or fully electric operation, substantially reducing diesel emissions, lowering fuel expenditures and minimizing noise while enhancing the value of their existing fleets. Carrier Transicold is part of Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions.

Title: Danfoss unveils next-generation AxisPro proportional valve, increasing accessibility of intelligent hydraulics in industrial applications
Summary: NORDBORG, DENMARK — Danfoss Power Solutions today announced the launch of its next-generation Level 1 AxisPro® valve, rounding out the line of Vickers by Danfoss servo performance software-configurable proportional valves. With a new digital amplifier and support for industry-leading network protocols, the valve offers advanced performance, control, and seamless connectivity. Complementing the valve’s launch is Pro-FX™ Configure v2, the redesigned software configuration platform featuring an intuitive interface, streamlined setup, and real-time tuning for faster and easier installations. AxisPro valves are ideal for demanding industrial hydraulic applications such as presses, machine tools, factory automation, and more.

Title: Munters: industrial residues from Swedish industry become plasterboards
Summary: The joint efforts between NOAH, Munters and Stockholm Exergi are accelerating the transformation of Swedish industry towards increased circularity. Using fly ash from Swedish combined heat and power plants and salt residues from Munters manufacturing of desiccant rotors, Norgips is now producing brand new plasterboards.

Title: GREE Unveils New Products at Canton Fair！

These new products showcased GREE’s technological strength and breakthrough in the commercial air conditioning sector.

Title: MHIEC Receives Contract for Improvement of Core Equipment at Municipal Solid Waste Incineration Facility in Kanazawa
Summary: Tokyo, October 16, 2025 - Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Environmental & Chemical Engineering Co., Ltd. (MHIEC), a part of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) Group, has received a contract from the city of Kanazawa (Ishikawa Prefecture) to refurbish and improve the core facilities of the city's East Environmental Energy Center, a municipal solid waste (MSW) incineration plant. The renovation of the stoker-type incinerators(Note1) with processing capacity of 250 tons per day (tpd) aims to extend the life of the facility, enhance energy efficiency, and reduce CO2 emissions. The total value of the contract is 4.3 billion yen before tax, with work scheduled to be completed in March 2029.

Title: Carrier Transicold Introduces eCool-Drive: The First Power Converter Specially Designed for Electric Tractors
Summary: Carrier Transicold introduces eCool-Drive: A cutting-edge power solution that transforms high-voltage direct current from a tractor’s battery into the alternating current needed to operate a refrigeration unit. This innovative system, which electrifies existing diesel refrigeration units and enables seamless connection between any refrigerated semi-trailer and a 100% electric towing vehicle, will be presented at Solutrans 2025, held Nov. 18-22 at Lyon EUREXPO. Carrier Transicold is part of Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions.
